message.content:
{"id": "7785", "title": "Bug 7785: SaveAs Forgets the file type", "description": "Bug 7785: SaveAs Forgets the file type. The icon has also changed from the parent java file icon to a generic file icon.", "OB": "1) Open an existing java file. 
2) Modify the java file (e.g., move an existing class). 
3) Click on the SaveAs icon located next to the Save Icon. 
A dialog box will appear. 
4) Browse for a valid container location. 
5) Enter the filename without specifying the extension, as it is not requested. 
6) Click Ok. 
Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, but the file extension is not shown.", "EB": "The file extension should be displayed in the Navigator after using the SaveAs function.", "SR": "1) Open an existing java file.
2) Modify the java file (e.g., move an existing class).
3) Click on the SaveAs icon located next to the Save Icon.
A dialog box will appear.
4) Browse for a valid container location.
5) Enter the filename without specifying the extension, as it is not requested.
6) Click Ok.
Verify that the Navigator displays the file with its corresponding file extension in the specified location."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '7785', 'title': 'Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type', 'description': 'Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon. ', 'OB': "1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': "1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown. "}
